## Code Quality Checklist

### Code Standards
- [ ] Code follows the project's style guidelines (`cargo fmt`)
- [ ] Code passes linting checks (`cargo clippy -- -D warnings`)
- [ ] All tests pass (`cargo test`)
- [ ] Documentation is updated (if applicable)
- [ ] Commit messages follow [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/)

### Documentation
- [ ] Public APIs have doc comments
- [ ] README updated (if user-facing changes)
- [ ] CHANGELOG.md updated (if user-facing changes)
- [ ] Code examples work and are tested
- [ ] Architecture docs updated (if design changes)

### Security
- [ ] No secrets or credentials committed
- [ ] Security implications reviewed
- [ ] Dependencies are up-to-date and audited (`cargo audit`)
- [ ] Unsafe code is documented with safety invariants

### Performance
- [ ] Performance impact assessed
- [ ] Benchmarks run (if performance-critical)
- [ ] No memory leaks (verified with profiling)
- [ ] WASM size impact checked (if applicable)

## Reviewer Checklist
<!-- For maintainers - do not fill out -->

- [ ] Code quality meets project standards
- [ ] Test coverage is adequate
- [ ] Documentation is complete and accurate
- [ ] No security vulnerabilities introduced
- [ ] Performance impact is acceptable
- [ ] Breaking changes are justified and documented
- [ ] CI/CD passes all checks
- [ ] Ready to merge
